intro: Protea trichophylla, commonly known as the silver protea, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescence composed of numerous white to pale pink flowers surrounded by a dense, fluffy layer of modified leaves called bracts. The plant is native to the Western and Eastern Cape provinces, where it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it requires specific care to flourish. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
